Callout.Text: Click Here to Reserve Your Place Today!

Organizers.Name: Rory Braybrook - North Shore .net User Group & Auckland Azure User Group
Daniel Scott-Raynsford - Auckland Azure User Group
Aben Samuel - Auckland Azure User Group
Buddy Davies - Auckland Azure User Group

Sessions.Title: Keynote from David Howden, Head of Cloud @ Umbrellar
Azure DevOps in Action
Sessions.Room: William will discuss some of the common problems with software development. He will share some design considerations around CI/CD pipeline, and development practice. The session will be finished with a demonstration of Azure DevOps from code commit and deploy all the way to production by going through various of automation testing phases and environments using Infrastructure as Code.

Speaker.Name: William Wang
Speaker.Description: William came from software development background, now specializing in Cloud architecture and DevOps consultancy. William has helped a number of organizations from the cloud adoption and transformation to DevOps practice and assessment to deliver better business results with smart technology decisions and implementation. William has a strong focus around Azure PaaS, Azure DevOps and modern application development with industry patterns and practice.

Sessions.Title: Azure Identity
Sessions.Room: A look at the Azure I&AM landscape and what protocols and technologies are appropriate for different use cases.

Speaker.Name: Rory Braybrook
Speaker.Description: I work across the Microsoft Identity stack consulting to companies world-wide wrt. moving from legacy systems to the cloud. I help on-premises users with ADFS. Dev. wise, I advise on the MSAL, ADAL and OWIN stacks and how to integrate these with the various IDP.

Sessions.Title: Lunch, Labs and Ask an Expert
Azure Functions - Bindings and Authentication
Sessions.Room: In this session we take a look at some of the bindings available to you and how you might go about creating your own custom bindings using the binding extensibility framework. We'll then have a go at putting together a simple SPA application that includes authenticating to back end functions via Azure Active Directory and serving up content using the Azure Function SignalR and CosmosDb trigger bindings.

Speaker.Name: Dave Theunissen
Speaker.Organization: Cloud & DevOps Consultant @ Fidelity Life Assurance Company
Speaker.Description: David is a Software Engineer with a focus on leading cloud adoption and DevOps practices. He's been developing systems on the Microsoft .NET stack for almost 10 years, and is passionate about software engineering, DevOps practices and Azure related technologies. His focus over the past few years has been in cloud and microservice architecture, development and continuous delivery. He is an active member of the wider the development community, sharing and talking about Azure technologies through his blog, social media and at various meetup groups.

Sessions.Title: Using Azure Resource Manager Templates to supercharge your Azure Deployments
Sessions.Room: Whether you’re a Developer building applications or an IT Pro building IaaS virtual data centres in Azure, at some point you're going to want to use modern development practices to build and define those systems. Azure Resource Manager Templates is the extremely flexible and powerful declarative Infrastructure as Code system that is baked in to Azure. In this session we'll take a look at what Azure Resource Manager templates are, how to create and edit them and what tools, tricks and tips are available to you to master this very powerful tool.

Speaker.Name: Daniel Scott-Raynsford
Speaker.Description: Daniel is Manager of Release Engineering at IAG and is also a Microsoft MVP in Cloud and Datacenter Management since 2017, specializing in cloud, automation, DevOps and continuous delivery practices. A software engineer and systems architect for 16 years, Daniel made the move to specializing in DevOps and contemporary delivery practices 6 years ago. He is an passionate evangelist for delivering better value for customers by optimizing how we think about and deliver software and infrastructure. Daniel supports the community by co-organizing the Auckland Azure User Group and writing his own DevOps, Cloud and Automation blog. Daniel is also a regular contributor and maintainer of many Microsoft open source projects as well as running several of his community open source projects focusing on PowerShell, PowerShell DSC and Azure.

Sessions.Title: Keynote from David Howden, Head of Cloud @ Umbrellar
Azure Journey – Walk the walk
Sessions.Room: Azure is innovating and pioneering information technology, impacting the way we buy, build and use IT services. Is cloud a philosophy, a giant somebody’s computer or an innovation hub? How should we start our journey to the new, innovative and fast-changing universe of the cloud using Cloud Framework, Governance to Migration? Let’s talk!

Speaker.Name: Ajay Nabh
Speaker.Description: Ajay has an extensive background with over 18 Years in IT ranging from Business Support to IT Solution design and consulting. He has broad experience that extends right across the infrastructure stack along with Azure and Azure Stack. His role as Senior Cloud Consultant requires leadership in the use of technology and its alignment to business and enjoys the challenge of applying his knowledge to customer business challenges.

Sessions.Title: Running Super Mario in Azure
Sessions.Room: This session is going to introduce you all to some of the basics around container, what they are, why theyre here and how a tech persons role may look. We will cover off some live use cases of container based solutions and the services available within Azure for running them. You will start with running a container on your laptop, then taking that same code and running it Azure using different services. Wrapping up with a brief look at some operational point and a call to action for taking this further in your own time.

Speaker.Name: Buddy Davies
Speaker.Organization: Azure Tech Team Lead @ provoke Solutions
Speaker.Description: Buddy has historically been involved in traditional Data Center infrastructure before embarking on a transition to focusing on building solutions within Microsoft Azure. He is currently the Azure Infrastructure Team Lead @ Provoke where he spends a lot of his time honing his DevOps skills and working closely with some of the brightest application architects to build cool solutions on technologies in Azure.

Sessions.Title: Lunch, Labs and Ask an Expert
Azure Stack an extension of Azure
Sessions.Room: How does this Hybrid model work – Consistency around portal, pricing, Azure look and feel and technical specs including demo and Q&A.

Speaker.Name: Marcelino Richarte
Speaker.Organization: Cloud Platform Engineer, Azure Stack, Umbrellar
Speaker.Description: Marcelino is a Professional and an accomplished information technology specialist with extensive background in Microsoft troubleshooting and diagnosing with over 16 years experience overall, ranging from various technologies, setups and infrastructure with creating hybrid solutions and making cloud computing possible.

Sessions.Title: 9 ways to completely mess up Security of your Azure Platform
Sessions.Room: A common misconception is that moving to the cloud means your data and your platform is completely secure. DON’T Worry, it is not. In this session, I intent to show you 9 different topics, you shouldn’t do so that you can keep your Microsoft Azure platform remain vulnerable and provide all the surface area required for a large scale attack. Finally something in common to your On-premises platform.

Speaker.Name: Aben Samuel
Speaker.Organization: Principal Consultant and Product Manager at Fusion5
Speaker.Description: As a Cloud consultant for the past 6 years, I have seen the journey and sentiment about moving to the cloud of many customers. It is no longer a 'should we' question, but rather a 'when' question. As a Principal Consultant leading a team of Cloud Architects and Engineers, I have had the unique front seat to watching this transform the way our clients do business. As a Product Manager, I have the unique opportunity to listen to some of my really smart colleagues and combine that with what my customers need which helps me shape Fusion5 journey with Cloud Technology, especially Microsoft Azure.
